info.title: xDome API
info.description:
# Authentication
To use this API, create an API user from Admin Settings > User Management, and generate an
API token. Use the token as an [HTTP bearer token](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#authentication_schemes)
to authenticate and authorize your API requests.

To use the token, add an `Authorization` header such as:
```
Authorization: Bearer <your token here>
```

# API Conventions

## Pagination
The endpoints in this API are paginated. To iteratively obtain all data, make repeated
requests with increasing `offset` starting at 0, and constant `limit`. For example,
`{"offset": 0, "limit": 100}`, followed by `{"offset": 100, "limit": 100}`, `{"offset":
200, "limit": 100}`, until less than `limit` results are returned.

## Filters
The endpoints in this API accept a `filter_by` argument to filter the results returned by
the endpoint. Filters can be simple filters over a single field, or compound filters made
up of other fields. For an example, look at the `filter_by` parameter of the endpoints
below.

### Simple Filters
Filters a single field of the result set. The `operation` may be one of:

|`operation`s|Description|`value` Type|
|---|---|---|
|`in`, `not_in`|Checks for equality/inequality of any of the values|Array of values|
|`contains`, `not_contains`|Checks if the string in `value` is contained in the field|string|
|`in_subnet`, `not_in_subnet`|Checks if an IP field is in the subnet in `value`|string or list of strings specifying an IP subnet in CIDR notation, such as `"192.168.1.0/24"`|
| `is_null`, `is_not_null`|Checks if the field has null value|_None_|
|`greater`, `greater_or_equal`, `less`, `less_or_equal`|Compares with `value`|a number or timestamp (ISO format) to compare with|
|`after_seconds_ago`, `before_seconds_ago`|Compares the field with a timestamp relative to the current date and time|number of seconds|

### Compound Filters
Simple filters can be combined with compound filters. The supported `operation`s are:
* `not` - Takes a single filter in `operands`, and negates the filter's condition
* `and`, `or` - Take multiple filters in `operands`, and combines them with the appropriate
boolean operation

post.description:
Get details of devices from the inventory. The data returned by this endpoint
corresponds to the Devices table in the dashboard.

Note that this endpoint will return all devices, including retired devices. To get only
non-retired devices, add a filter such as in the example in `filter_by`.

### About Multiple Network Interfaces
Fields ending with `_list` may have multiple values if a device has multiple network
interfaces. In this case, each such field will have an array entry for each interface, and
entries in corresponding indexes refer to the same interface.

For example, if a device has a network interface with IP `1.1.1.1` and MAC
`11-11-11-11-11-11`, and another with IP `2.2.2.2` and MAC `22-22-22-22-22-22`, both in the
"Corporate" network, the
returned data will be:

```json
{
    "ip_list": ["1.1.1.1", "2.2.2.2"],
    "mac_list": ["11-11-11-11-11-11", "22-22-22-22-22-22"],
    "network_list": ["Corporate","Corporate"]
}
```

medical_iot.summary: All medical and IoT devices (first page)

search.summary: Search for a device's serial number by MAC address

post.description: This API call allows setting Purdue level manually for associated devices. If set to null, the system will automatically designate the Purdue level based on the device type.

post.summary: Set the value of a device custom attribute
post.description:
This API call allows adding and removing custom attribute values for associated devices
based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices to add or remove custom attributes.

post.summary: Replace the value of a device custom attribute
post.description:
This API request enables replacing of all existing manual custom attribute
values with those specified in "values_to_add" for all associated devices
based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires to specify the name of the custom attribute whose
values should replaced, and the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices to replace custom attributes.

To erase all existing manual custom attribute values without replacing
with new values, set the "values_to_add" parameter to `null`.

post.summary: Get devices affected by an alert
post.description:
Get devices affected by an alert. This endpoint returns similar data to the [Get details of
devices][1] endpoint, except that only affected devices are returned. There is also an
additional device field indicating if the alert is resolved for the device.

### Fields supported by this endpoint
All fields supported by [Get details of devices][1] endpoint, and additionally:

| Field         | Description                                                                              | Supported Operations                                        |
|---------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|
| `is_resolved` | A boolean field indicating if the alert triggered for a device is resolved or unresolved | `is_not_null`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`in`,`not_in`,`equals` |

specific_alert_type.summary: Get alerts with a specific alert type (first page)

post.description:
The data returned by this endpoint corresponds to the Vulnerabilities table in the
dashboard.

Note that this endpoint will return all possible vulnerabilities, including those that
don't affect any devices in the inventory. To get only vulnerabilities that affect devices
in the inventory, add a filter such as in the example in `filter_by`.

### Fields supported by this endpoint

<details><summary>Click to expand</summary>

| Field                                         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | Supported Operations                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|-----------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `id`                                          | Unique identifier of the vulnerability                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | `not_starts_with`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`not_contains`,`ends_with`,`starts_with`,`equals`,`is_not_null`,`in`,`not_in`,`not_ends_with`,`contains`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |

with_affected_devices.summary: Get all vulnerabilities that affect a device in the inventory (first page)

specific_cve.summary: Get vulnerabilities with a specific CVE (first page)

post.summary: Get devices affected by a vulnerability
post.description:
Get devices affected by a vulnerability. This endpoint returns similar data to the
`api/v1/devices/` endpoint, except that only affected devices are returned. There are also
additional device fields with information about how the device is related to the
vulnerability.

### Fields supported by this endpoint
All fields supported by [Get details of devices][1] endpoint, and additionally:

| Field                        | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Supported Operations                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `vulnerability_relevance`    | The device vulnerability status reflecting the confidence level of the detection process, corresponding to several components, such as the vulnerability type and accuracy of device data, such as "Confirmed" or "Potentially Relevant" | `not_starts_with`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`not_contains`,`ends_with`,`starts_with`,`equals`,`is_not_null`,`in`,`not_in`,`not_ends_with`,`contains`                                                                                                    |
| `vulnerability_source`       | The source that designated the devices affected by the vulnerability, such as "Rapid7"                                                                                                                                                   | `not_starts_with`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`not_contains`,`ends_with`,`starts_with`,`equals`,`is_not_null`,`in`,`not_in`,`not_ends_with`,`contains`                                                                                                    |
| `vulnerability_last_updated` | Date and time when the status of the affected device was updated                                                                                                                                                                         | `is_null`,`after`,`before_seconds_ago`,`equals`,`before_seconds_from_now`,`is_not_null`,`between`,`not_equals`,`after_seconds_ago`,`less`,`after_seconds_from_now`,`greater_or_equal`,`in`,`not_in`,`greater`,`less_or_equal`,`not_between`,`before` |
| `vulnerability_last_changed` | This field has been renamed to `vulnerability_last_updated`. The old name is deprecated, but will continue to be supported in this API version for backwards compatibility.                                                              | `is_null`,`after`,`before_seconds_ago`,`equals`,`before_seconds_from_now`,`is_not_null`,`between`,`not_equals`,`after_seconds_ago`,`less`,`after_seconds_from_now`,`greater_or_equal`,`in`,`not_in`,`greater`,`less_or_equal`,`not_between`,`before` |
| `vulnerability_status`       | This field has been renamed to `vulnerability_relevance`. The old name is deprecated, but will continue to be supported in this API version for backwards compatibility.                                                                 | `not_starts_with`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`not_contains`,`ends_with`,`starts_with`,`equals`,`is_not_null`,`in`,`not_in`,`not_ends_with`,`contains`                                                                                                    |

post.description:
Get details of devices with their related vulnerabilities from the database.
The data returned by this endpoint for each device corresponds to the vulnerabilities
table in the single device page.

### Fields supported by this endpoint
#### Device attributes
This endpoint combines both device and vulnerability attributes.
The device related attributes appear with a "device" prefix to better
identify the device output.

#### Vulnerability attributes
This endpoint combines both device and vulnerability attributes.
The vulnerability related attributes appear with a "vulnerability" prefix to better
identify the vulnerability output.
Please see the ["get details of vulnerability"](#tag/Vulnerabilities/operation/get_vulnerabilities_api_v1_vulnerabilities__post) endpoint.

specific_cve.summary: Get vulnerabilities with a specific CVE (first page)

post.description:
This API call allows you to set relevance for specific vulnerabilities
on associated devices.
The mandatory vulnerabilities filter_by parameter requires a list of vulnerability
IDs or names to update the relevance.
With the optional devices filter_by, the API will exclusively mark the relevance for
device-vulnerability relationships that meet the device filter criteria.

post.summary: Set status for device alert relations
post.description:
Set device-alert status to resolved or unresolved.
If no filter_by parameter is provided, this API call will resolve or unresolve
all device-alert relations for the specified alert IDs.
if a filter_by parameter is provided, the API call will
exclusively resolve or unresolve device-alert relations that
meet the specified filter criteria


### Fields supported by this endpoint
All fields supported by [Get details of devices][1].

[1]: #operation/get_devices

This API call allows adding and removing existing labels for associated devices,
alerts, and vulnerabilities based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices, alerts,
or vulnerabilities to add or remove labels.

It will always return `null`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | _Not filterable_                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

</details>

This API request enables replacing of all existing manual
labels with those specified in "labels_to_add"
for associated devices,
alerts, and vulnerabilities based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices, alerts,
or vulnerabilities to replace labels.

To erase all existing manual labels without replacing with new values,
set the "labels_to_add" parameter to `null`.

This API call allows adding and removing assignees for associated devices,
alerts, and vulnerabilities based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices, alerts, or vulnerabilities
for which the assignees attribute will be configured.
Make sure to specify whether the action is for group or individual assignees.

This API request enables replacing of all existing manual assignees with those specified
in "usernames_to_add" or "group_names_to_add" for all associated devices,
alerts, and vulnerabilities based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which is
instrumental in selecting the specific devices, alerts, or vulnerabilities
to replace assignees.

To erase all existing manual assignees without replacing with new values,
set the "usernames_to_add" and "group_names_to_add" parameters to `null`.

  `alert_ids`
  > **Note**: the "alert" target type does not support the standard "filter_by" parameter
  > and instead accepts a list of alert IDs: `alert_ids: [1, 2, 3]`

This API call allows adding notes to associated devices,
alerts, and vulnerabilities based on the selected target_type.
The API call requires the use of the filter_by parameter, which
is instrumental in selecting the specific devices, alerts, or
vulnerabilities for which the note will be added.
The default action is append, allowing to add additional
text to existing notes; to replace existing notes, use the overwrite option.

post.description:
This API endpoint adds a new Site-Device Attribution Rule.

Each Site-Device Attribution Rule is composed of a Site ID and a Device Query Filter.
When executed, the rule will associate devices that match the filter with the rule's Site.

### Supported Query Filter Fields and Structure
The `query_filter` field of the Site-Device Attribution Rule is a `QueryFilter` object used
to match devices to the rule. It is similar to the Query Filter object used in the devices
endpoint, with a limited set of fields and structure. The best way to build a valid
rule is to first create a similar filter in the dashboard and then copy the JSON structure
and modify it as needed for each site.

The following device fields are supported in a Site-Device Attribution Rule's
Query Filter:

<details><summary>Click to expand</summary>

| Field                                   | Description                                                                                                                                                                          | Supported Operations                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|-----------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

The Query Filters used by Site-Device Attribution Rules are also limited to Simple Query
Filters or a maximum of 2-levels of Compound Query Filters with up to one OR operation
wrapping up to one level of AND operations. These constraints align with the filter
structure supported by the dashboard UI in the Site Management page.
<details>
    <summary>Examples of valid and invalid structures</summary>
    <ul>
        <li>Valid: A (a SimpleQueryFilter object)</li>
        <li>Valid: A and B</li>
        <li>Valid: A or B</li>
        <li>Valid: (A and B) or C</li>
        <li>Valid: (A and B) or (C and D)</li>
        <li>Invalid: (A and B) and C</li>
        <li>Invalid: (A or B) and C</li>
        <li>Invalid: A or (not B)</li>
        <li>Invalid: (A and B) or (C and (D or E))</li>
    </ul>
</details>

Get list of all Edge Locations

post.summary: Push CMMS Assets Table to xDome
post.description:
This API call (`/api/v1/cmms/assets/add`) enables you to push CMMS assets to the Unmatched CMMS Assets table. ### Required Parameters To enable accurate matching, each CMMS asset object must include the following fields:
  • cmms_uid
  • cmms_manufacturer
  • cmms_model
  • cmms_serial_number

Note: The matching process requires a separate call to `/api/v1/cmms/match` and is not performed automatically upon asset upload.

### CMMS Reconciliation: Dashboard Updates Once the `/api/v1/cmms/assets/add` API call is completed, the Unmatched Devices Table will be updated accordingly. The Reconciliation Overview page will update its metrics to reflect the number of newly added, unmatched CMMS assets. To navigate to the Unmatched Devices Table, go to Operational Efficiency > CMMS Reconciliation > Unmatched Devices > Unmatched CMMS Assets. To trigger the matching process, use the `/api/v1/cmms/match` endpoint listed below. ### Fields supported by this endpoint
Click to expand | Field | Description | Supported Operations | |----------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | `cmms_uid` | The designated identifier of the device, as extracted from the CMMS platform. This field is Mandatory for Push Asset Table request. | `not_starts_with`,`is_null`,`not_equals`,`not_contains`,`ends_with`,`starts_with`,`equals`,`is_not_null`,`in`,`not_in`,`not_ends_with`,`contains` | | `cmms_model` | The model of the device, as extracted from the CMMS platform. 423.description: There is already an active CMMS integration

post.description: This API allows you to delete CMMS assets. The deletion will only impact the CMMS assets and will not affect any xDome devices connected to those assets. To use this API call use the `filter_by` to specify the relevant CMMS assets.

423.description: There is already an active CMMS integration

post.summary: Match CMMS Assets to xDome Devices
post.description: This API allows you to match CMMS assets with xDome devices using xDome advanced matching algorithm. Results will be available in the CMMS Reconciliation page, under the Matched Devices section, within a few minutes.

post.description: This API call allows you to retrieve the current status of the asset matching task initiated with the `/api/v1/cmms/assets/match` call. It provides visibility into the progress and outcome of the CMMS assets' matching process, which are pushed to the xDome's Matched Devices table.

post.summary: Get Matched CMMS Assets and Devices
post.description:
The data returned by this endpoint corresponds to the Devices table in the dashboard
and allows you to get details of pushed CMMS assets and matched devices from the
inventory. Note that this endpoint will return all assets and only devices with
matching CMMS/CMDB assets, including retired devices. To retrieve only non-retired
devices, implement a filter as demonstrated in the `filter_by` example.

### About Multiple Network Interfaces
Fields that end with `_list` could have multiple values if a device has several network
interfaces. In this case, each field will have an array entry for each interface, and
entries in corresponding indexes refer to the same interface.

For example, if a device has a network interface with IP `1.1.1.1` and MAC
`11-11-11-11-11-11`, and another with IP `2.2.2.2` and MAC `22-22-22-22-22-22`, both in the
"Corporate" network, the returned data will be:

```json
{
    "ip_list": ["1.1.1.1", "2.2.2.2"],
    "mac_list": ["11-11-11-11-11-11", "22-22-22-22-22-22"],
    "network_list": ["Corporate","Corporate"]
}
```

devices_vulnerabilities.vulnerability_affected_products:
* All the Wi-Fi devices
* Aruba:
    - ArubaOS 6.4.x: prior to 6.4.4.25
    - ArubaOS 6.5.x: prior to 6.5.4.19
    - ArubaOS 8.3.x: prior to 8.3.0.15
    - ArubaOS 8.5.x: prior to 8.5.0.12
    - ArubaOS 8.6.x: prior to 8.6.0.8
    - ArubaOS 8.7.x: prior to 8.7.1.2
    - Aruba instant AP
* SUSE:
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 15
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11
    - SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 11
* Synology:
    - RT2600ac
    - MR2200ac
    - RT1900ac
* Microsoft - according to the affected versions detailed in the attached advisories.
* Juniper:
    * the following models affected in specific versions and see attached advisory:
        - AP12 / AP21 / AP32 / AP33 / AP41 / AP43 / AP61 / AP63 / SRX series
devices_vulnerabilities.vulnerability_description:
A collection of new 12 security vulnerabilities that affect Wi-Fi devices.
An adversary that is within range of a victim's Wi-Fi network can abuse these vulnerabilities to
steal user information or attack devices.
Three of the discovered vulnerabilities are design flaws in the Wi-Fi standard and therefore
affect most devices. On top of this, several other vulnerabilities were discovered that are
caused by widespread programming mistakes in Wi-Fi products.
Experiments indicate that every Wi-Fi product is affected by at least one vulnerability
and that most products are affected by several vulnerabilities.
The discovered vulnerabilities affect all modern security protocols of Wi-Fi, including the
latest WPA3.
The design flaws are hard to abuse because doing so requires user interaction or is only possible
when using uncommon network settings. As a result, in practice the biggest concern are the
programming mistakes in Wi-Fi products since several of them are trivial to exploit.
When a website is configured with HSTS to always use HTTPS as an extra layer of security,
the transmitted data cannot be stolen
devices_vulnerabilities.vulnerability_recommendations:
See the following advisories released by the vendors,
which details what mitigation steps should be done:
* Aruba - https://www.arubanetworks.com/assets/alert/ARUBA-PSA-2021-011.txt
* Arista - https://www.arista.com/en/support/advisories-notices/security-advisories/12602-security
* Canonical (Ubuntu) - https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2020-24587
* Cisco - https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-wifi-faf
* Debian - https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-24587
* Intel - https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00473.html
* Juniper Networks - https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA11170&cat=SIRT_1
* Lenovo - https://support.lenovo.com/us/en/product_security/LEN-57316
* Synology - https://www.synology.com/tr-tr/security/advisory/Synology_SA_21_20
* SUSE - https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=000020244
* Wi-Fi Alliance - https://www.wi-fi.org/security-update-fragmentation

vulnerabilities.description: A Incorrect Default Permissions vulnerability in the packaging of inn of SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11-SP3; openSUSE Backports SLE-15-SP2, openSUSE Leap 15.2 allows local attackers to escalate their privileges from the news user to root. This issue affects: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11-SP3 inn version inn-2.4.2-170.21.3.1 and prior versions. openSUSE Backports SLE-15-SP2 inn versions prior to 2.6.2. openSUSE Leap 15.2 inn versions prior to 2.6.2.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-31998

vulnerabilities.affected_products: ZOLL Defibrillator Dashboard, a Defibrillator device management platform, running all versions prior to 2.2
vulnerabilities.description:
6 vulnerabilities in ZOLL Defibrillator Dashboard, which some of them can be exploited remotely and require a low level of skill to exploit. 
The vulnerabilities including, unrestricted file upload, sensitive data stored in cleartext, and more.
Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow remote code execution and theft of sensitive information which could allow an attacker to gain access to credentials, or impact confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the application.
vulnerabilities.name: ICSMA-21-161-01 (ZOLL Defibrillator Dashboard)
vulnerabilities.recommendations:
ZOLL recommends users of affected versions mitigate these vulnerabilities by upgrading to the latest version of Defibrillator Dashboard Version 2.2 or later. For upgrade assistance or questions, please contact ZOLL Data Products Technical Support by phone at 800-348-9011 option one, or via email at supportdata@zoll.com

ZOLL recommends users of affected versions keep in mind data on the defibrillator device should be considered the source of accurate data, should there be any discrepancy with the Defibrillator Dashboard.
Users should perform frequent local checks to confirm readiness of the devices as per manuals.

ZOLL recommends users disable the password autocomplete function on browsers accessing the Defibrillator Dashboard.

edge_location_enabled.title: Edge Location Enabled
edge_location_enabled.description: Specifies the status of the Edge Location. If set to True, the Edge Location is enabled; if set to False, it is disabled. If this field is absent in the request, the existing status will remain unchanged.

edge_location_description.title: Edge Location Description
edge_location_description.description: Specifies the Edge Location description. If a value is provided, it will override the existing description. If None is provided, the existing description will be deleted. If this field is absent in the request, the existing description will remain unchanged.

edge_location_note.title: Edge Location Note
edge_location_note.description: Specifies the Edge Location note. If a value is provided, it will overwrite the existing note. If None is provided, the existing note will be deleted. If this field is absent in the request, the existing note will remain unchanged.

associated_site_name.title: Associated Site Name
associated_site_name.description: Specifies the site name that the Edge Location is associated with. If a value is provided, it will override the existing site name. If None is provided, the existing association with site will be deleted. If this field is absent in the request, the existing site name will remain unchanged.
